text: It’s more iconic. Goes for £500-£1k in second hand trade. 1945 paper, not many copies about, still in copyright and not republished. You can buy Art of Legging on Amazon. There’s not much alpha in either, but as a historical take on what went on before I find them entertaining

text: That’s foundational, to some degree, of how tissue prices were done for a long old time. Betting to a common payout (getting a book all green), or to a common liability (which looks rather like “betting about the favourite” in a lot of practical terms), came rather late, wasn’t needed for a while thanks to an average over-round of 3%-4% per runner for a century or two. :)

needed for a while thanks to an average over-round of 3%-4% per runner for a century or two. :)

text: Obvious questions are: what variable, (or variables)? How well does that method perform? And given we are no longer constrained to ledger book entries noting the takeout in pounds, shillings, and pence, but are armed with a magical device that can do billions of calculations a second, is there a better way?

text:
<@UBS7QANF3> <@U012XF5CNPN> So, I may have over simplified it, but it is the sort of way I have tried it, but the "variable" is basically a set of derived indicators (volume traded, vol available, ...), which combine to some total ""variable"" which I then make into a book as described.....!
I should be up in London for the meetup this Tuesday, so maybe if you're there we can discuss this over a beer !?

text:
1. So "margin" I thought is the difference from a selection "my book price" and "bookmaker price" ? not sure how that affects "my book price" ?
2. Staking methods/size is to do with whether you trade an opportunity "flat" stake, "kelly..", "liability",...?
3. "inventory" not sure what that means in this context? sounds like "managing a set of active trades" ?

elements.text: So "margin" I thought is the difference from a selection "my book price" and "bookmaker price" ? not sure how that affects "my book price" ?
Staking methods/size is to do with whether you trade an opportunity "flat" stake, "kelly..", "liability",...?
"inventory" not sure what that means in this context? sounds like "managing a set of active trades" ?

text: Bookmaking is different to making individual prices and theoretical books. It's balanced on risk. If everyone has bet on the fav it doesn't matter what price it is if it wins, you're screwed. (rip John Mccririck) So you limit punters, slash the price or just stop taking bets... And therefore the old assumption that half the money is on the evens horse at a bookie, but an exchange isn't similarly constrained.

elements.text: Bookmaking is different to making individual prices and theoretical books. It's balanced on risk. If everyone has bet on the fav it doesn't matter what price it is if it wins, you're screwed. (rip John Mccririck) So you limit punters, slash the price or just stop taking bets... And therefore the old assumption that half the money is on the evens horse at a bookie, but an exchange isn't similarly constrained.
